intro: Tanacetum audibertii, commonly known as Audibert's tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, gray-green leaves and yellow button-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in moist meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges. Its aromatic properties make it a valuable plant in traditional herbal medicine and horticulture.
